intro: Aquilegia caryophylloides, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that features showy, spurred flowers in shades of purple and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers bloom in early to mid-summer. It is native to the western United States and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
